page.title: 07MARWOOD N. MICROFILM CENTRE.
page.content: The Wessex Microfilm Centre is the largest individual employer in the block. Microfilm is a copy of something made a lot smaller and put on rolls of transparent film. The centre,on Muddiford Hill employs 12 people at the moment.In the 17years that the firm has been here Mr.Spink reckons that they have copied 50,000,000 documents or pages of newspaper and used 450miles of film which is as far as London and back. The average cost of 100 exposures on a film is Â£10. All the newspapers in the S.W.are microfilmed here for libraries to keep a copy.Solicitors,engineering firms, local authorities,together with the library service are the main users of this facility.
